summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for August 1, 2019. It details routine operational activities, inmate counts, movements, and statuses across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The log records inmate transfers, hospital visits, and administrative detentions, but contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein or his case.

events.title: Daily Correctional Center Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, security checks, inmate movements between units and hospitals, and administrative detentions.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This is a routine daily operations log from the MCC New York dated August 1, 2019, showing no direct activity related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The log details standard procedures: inmate counts, security system checks, body alarm tests, and inmate movements between general population, special housing, hospitals, and a nursing facility.
Several inmates were placed in Administrative Detention or the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for unspecified reasons.
The log confirms the facility was monitoring for STG/High Alert phone calls and WITSEC inquiries, but received none during these shifts.
The document is significant as a sample of normal prison operations on a date shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility on August 10, 2019.
